channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report I-2024100112
item.description:
Report I-2024100112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-21
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TEAM LEGACY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank truck was being loaded with 45,000 lbs of formaldehyde distillate(13% concentration). Toward the end of loading, a high-level probe should have stopped the pump and prevented over-filling of the truck. The probe was tripped, but the automatic valve responded more slowly than optimal resulting in a spill of about 10 gallons(100-lbs) that flowed down the side of the truck on to the truck loading pad, and then toward the secondary'containment ditch to the east of the pad. The truck and loading pad were washed down with water Into the containment ditch. From there, it drained into a sump and was conveyed by an in-place submersible pump to a recycle storage tank. Investigation found that the high-level probe triggered immediately on contact with the solution, but that the automatic valve closed slowly, and that the truck tank had a taller than usual dome-lid extension.

item.title: Report X-2024101013
item.description:
Report X-2024101013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO PLASTIC 15L CONTAINERS OF FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS. ONE PLASTIC CONTAINER IS MARKED AND LABELLED AS TOLUENE 99% WITH A UN NUMBER OF DIETHYL ETHER, UN1155, CLASS 3, PG II. SECOND BOTTLE IS LABELLED AS ISOPROPANOL 99%, UN1219, PG II. BOTH LEAKING FROM THEIR CLOSURES WITH APPROXIMATELY FIVE LITERS TOTAL LEAKING. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN NEW YORK USING UPS SHIPPER NUMBER KE7177, CLARITY CHEMICAL CORPORATION, 411 N EVANS CREEK RD, ROGUE RIVER OR 97537-4685.

item.title: Report X-2024100957
item.description:
Report X-2024100957

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER (PSC) RECIEVED A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE WEST UNLOAD AT DOOR 4. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) WAS THEN DISPATCHED TO THE AREA. THE DR CLEANED UP THE SITE OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND TRANSPORTED IT BACK TO THE PSC. A RESPONDER THEN PROCESSED AND CORRECTLY DISPOSED OF THE HAZARDOUS WASTE OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2024100315
item.description:
Report E-2024100315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: HAWAIIAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the inital descent of HA26 from HNL-PDX (N382) a apple Ipad became stuck in a lie flat first class seat (2G) and when the passenger retracted the seat the ipad was crushed. Flight Attendants removed Ipad from the seat and placed the ipad in a fire containment bag per documented procedures. Smoke was prsent in the cabin. Fire was not present.
